item.title: Users are unable to start sessions when using older versions of Frame Enterprise Profile Driver
item.content:encoded:
Feb 27, 12:34 PST
Resolved - The update has been applied to all affected accounts with Enterprise Profiles. All instances should have received an update and are functioning as intended.

If you are still experiencing an issue, please create a support ticket so our support team can assist you further.

Feb 27, 10:45 PST
Monitoring - The update has been rolled out to all Accounts on the Frame Commercial Platform using affected versions of Frame Enterprise Profiles.

We will continue to monitor the situation, and any additional updates will be posted on status.nutanix.com

Feb 27, 09:18 PST
Update - We have deployed the update to all Accounts using affected versions of Frame Enterprise Profiles . All instances already on must be rebooted for the update to take effect. If you have instances running, please lower the min and buffer settings to 0 and the max set to the number of instances with a current user in a session, allow the instances to turn off, and then return their values to the original numbers. Alternatively, if you wish, you can go to the "Status" page of your Account Dashboard and manually reboot any running instances. Any instances that are not powered on will get the update when they are powered on.

Please note that instances could take longer to boot/power on after the update. This is normal, and subsequent attempts will return to regular times.

We will continue to monitor the situation, and any additional updates will be posted on status.nutanix.com

Feb 27, 08:45 PST
Update - We are preparing to deploy a update for accounts affected by the certificate expiring on older versions of Enterprise Profiles. This will update instances to the latest version of Enterprise Profiles. Please note that VMs could take longer to boot/power on after the update. This is normal, and subsequent attempts will return to regular times.

We will continue to monitor the situation, and any additional updates will be posted on status.nutanix.com

Feb 27, 08:43 PST
Update - We are preparing to deploy a update for accounts affected by the certificate expiring on older versions of Enterprise Profiles. This will update instances to the latest version of Enterprise Profiles. Please note that VMs could take longer to boot/power on after the update. This is normal, and subsequent attempts will return to regular times.

We will continue to monitor the situation, and any additional updates will be posted on status.nutanix.com

Feb 27, 06:12 PST
Update - Customers using Frame Enterprise Profiles versions prior to 6.8.4.8008 are impacted by this issue. Affected customers should update their Frame Enterprise Profile Driver on their Sandbox by running the Frame Agent Setup Tool utility, which can be found under C:\ProgramData\Nutanix\Frame\Tools\FrameAgentSetupTool.exe or you can download via portal.nutanix.com (Downloads > Frame > Frame Agent Setup Tool). A Publish is required after the update is complete. We are also working on releasing an update to automatically force an update of the driver to the latest version.

Feb 27, 01:39 PST
Identified - Users are unable to start new sessions to Accounts with Enterprise Profiles enabled if it is using older versions of the Enterprise Profile driver (prior to 6.8.4.8008). This is due to an expired driver certificate. Users already in session are not affected.

The solution is to update the Frame Enterprise Profile Driver to version 6.8.4.8008 using our Frame Agent Setup Tool (https://docs.frame.nutanix.com/platform/admin/frame-agent-setup-tool/#updater-view) on the Sandbox and run a Publish on affected Accounts.

May 26, 09:05 PDT
Investigating - We are receiving reports that keyboard input within a Frame session stops working after a user presses Left CTRL+V or Left CTRL+ALT. After using the hotkey the Left CTRL key can become stuck (requiring the user to click Left CTRL again to unstick the key) or the application window that the user is using loses focus (requiring the user to click on the application window).

This issue seems to be intermittent and is affecting users accessing from Windows and Linux endpoints (macOS does not seem to be affected) using either a browser or Frame App.

We are investigating this issue and will provide updates as soon as they become available.

item.title: Azure AD Users May Be Unable to Authenticate to Frame or Receive New Persistent Desktop / User Volume
item.content:encoded:
May 12, 01:15 PDT
Resolved - An update to a backend SAML2 library resulted in XML Namespaces being improperly stripped from Azure AD SAML2 claims. This resulted in some users being unable to authenticate as Frame was unable to properly match these claims in order to establish user identify. Users who were able to authenticate may have improperly received a new Persistent Desktop and/or User Volume (Enterprise Profile or Personal Drive) upon starting a session. This issue seems to only affect customers on our Frame Commercial Platform using Azure AD via SAML2 integration with Frame. This issue was first reported at 1:15AM PDT and was resolved by 5:15AM PDT on Thursday, May 12, 2022.
